permissions.copyright-holder: SAGE/ Association Internationale de Méthodologie Sociologique

body.p: Full presentations of many of the entries below have already been distributed to BMS subscribers and RC33 members over the BMS-RC33 distribution list1

Le 14 juin 2011, à la Maison de l'Amérique latine à Paris, la rencontre « Communications et autour du n. 88 « Cultures du numérique” » (numéro de mai 2011) a été organisée par Antonio Casilli et comprenait une table ronde avec Edgar Morin, Antonio Casilli, Milad Doueihi, Nicole Lapierre, Edwy Plenel et Serge Tisseron. Cette rencontre était organisée en partenariat avec Mediapart. Fondée par Edgar Morin, Roland Barthes et Georges Friedmann en 1961, avec le soutien du CNRS et de l’EHESS, Communications a acquis un rayonnement international, comptant notamment parmi ses contributeurs Theodor W. Adorno, Umberto Eco, Noam Chomsky, Tzvetan Todorov, Paul Virilio, Jacques Le Goff. Plusieurs numéros, réédités en poche dans la collection « Points essais », ont également été traduits en anglais, portugais, espagnol et chinois. Visiter http://communication.revues.org/.

On 16-17 June 2011, in Cork, Ireland, the International Social Theory Consortium held its Tenth Annual Meeting, “Methods of Theorizing: Reflective Searches for Ways, Ideals and Measures”. See http://www.ucc.ie/en/DepartmentsCentresandUnits/Sociology/ConferencesandWorkshops/ISTC

On 19-22 June 2011, in Quebec City, Quebec, Canada, the 2011 International Total Survey Error Workshop (ITSEW) took place, “Moving Forward with Total Survey Error”. See http://nisla05.niss.org/ITSEW/index.html.

On 20-21 June 2011, at the Normandy Business School, Caen, France, the European Conference on Research Methodology for Business and Management Studies (ECRM) took place. See http://academic-conferences.org/ecrm/ecrm2011/ecrm11-home.htm.
Du 21 au 24 juin 2011, à Paris, les Ateliers d'analyse géométrique des données ont eu lieu à l'Université René Descartes. Voir http://www.mi.parisdescartes.fr/~lerb/ateliers/atelier.html.
On 22-23 June 2011, at the Institute of Historical Research in London, the Networks - History Lab Annual Conference 2011 took place; h-albion@h-net.msu.edu.

Les 23 et 24 juin 2011, au Centre de la Vieille Charité à Marseille, le colloque « Modèles et Apprentissages en Sciences Humaines et Sociales » (MASH 2011) a eu lieu. Voir http://www.greqam.fr/spip.php?rubrique1308.

On 23-25 June 2011, in Naples, Italy, Third International Workshop on Social Network Analysis (ARS’11), “Collaboration Networks and Knowledge Diffusion: Theory, Data and Methods”, took place. See http:www.ars2011.unisa.it.

On 30 June-1 July 2011, in Vilnius, Lithuania, European Values Study Workshop, “Understanding Value Patterns in Europe”, took place. The European Values Study is a unique survey research project in all 45 countries of Europe on how Europeans think about life, family, work, religion, politics and society (see http://www.europeanvaluesstudy.eu). The integrated data file of the most recent European Values Study wave is now available and can be obtained free of charge at Gesis Data Archive for the Social Sciences in Cologne through their online download and analysis facility ZECAT.

On 30 June-1 July 2011, in Grenoble, the LSE (Educational Sciences Laboratory, Université Pierre-Mendès-France), organized its seventh annual “From Word to Concept” workshop around the word “Value” (“Valeur” in French). Contact jacques.baille@upmf-grenoble.fr, gwenaelle.joet@upmf-grenoble.fr or alain.fernex@upmf-grenoble.fr.
On 4-8 July 2011, at the UAB in Barcelona, the Personal Networks Summer Course took place, organized by José Luis Molina. See http://grupsderecerca.uab.cat/egolab/content/summer-course.
On 6-8 July 2011, in Paris, the OECD organized the “New Directions in Welfare” conference. Visit http://www.open.ac.uk/socialsciences/welfareconomicstheory/.

On 26 July 2011, in Bamberg, Germany, the first English-language German National Educational Panel Study (NEPS) researcher training meeting took place. The NEPS collects extensive data on educational pathways in Germany. The first data was made available for the scientific community in July 2011. The NEPS offers researchers training at a regular basis that teaches conditions and ways how to use these data and shows specific statistical analysis procedures. Visit http://www.uni-bamberg.de/en/neps.

On 27-30 July 2011, at the ETH Zurich, Swiss Federal Institute of Technology, in Zurich, Switzerland, the workshop on “Game Theory and Society - Models of Social Interaction in Sociological Research” took place. See http://www.socio.ethz.ch/workshop2011.
On 30 July-4 August 2011, in Miami Beach, the American Statistical Association's 2011 Joint Statistical Meetings took place. See http://www.amstat.org/meetings/jsm/2011/index.cfm.

On 31 July-4 August 2011, in the Manor Road Building and St. Catherine’s College at the University of Oxford, in Oxford, England, the 33rd Conference of the International Association for Time Use Research took place. Visit http://iatur2011.timeuse.org/.

On 4 August 2011, in Miami Beach, at the American Statistical Association's 2011 Joint Statistical Meetings, a session on “multiple Designs for Census Data Collection and Surveys” was organized by Linda Hewitt (linhew@trinidad.net).

On 25-27 August 2011, at the University of Iceland, Reykjavik, the European Consortium for Political Research (ECPR) organized a panel discussion on “Non A Priori Modelling Methods for Political Science”. See http://www.ecprnet.eu/conferences/general_conference/Reykjavik/panel_details.asp?panelid=581.

On 28 August-6 September 2011, two European Science Foundation (ESF) Summer Schools in Quantitative Methods in the Social Sciences took place in Belgium and the Netherlands. They were “Analysis Methods for Cross-national Comparisons” on 28 August-4 September in Leuven, Belgium, and “Network Dynamics” on 29 August-6 September in Groningen. Visit http://www.ccsr.ac.uk/qmss/summer/Call_11.shtml.

Du 31 août au 2 septembre 2011, à Strasbourg, le Congrès 2011 de l'Association Française de Science Politique, « Agir par réseaux - Les réseaux en science politique - Méthodes et objets », a eu lieu. Visiter http://www.afsp.msh-paris.fr/.
On 1-2 September 2011, in Tallinn, Estonia, the Third Survey of Health, Ageing and Retirement in Europe (SHARE) User Conference took place. See http://www.share-project.org/sharelife.

On 7-10 September 2011, in Geneva, the European Sociological Association held its latest congress, organized around its 35 Research Networks and 29 Research Streams. See http://www.esa10thconference.com/CFP_website/.
On 9-10 September 2011, in Strasbourg, France, the international conference “Saul Alinsky: A Rebel or an Organizer?” took place (rets.guth@wanadoo.fr).

On 12-14 September 2011, at the University of Cologne, in Köln, Germany, the Research Training Group SOCLIFE organized the First SOCLIFE Workshop on the Analysis of Time in Context and Time as Context. Visit http://www.soclife.uni-koeln.de/workshop2011.html.

On 12-16 September 2011, in Vienna, at the European Conference on Complex Systems (ECCS'11), the satellite meeting “Urban Social Dynamics: Segregation and Criminality” took place. See http://www.lps.ens.fr/~risc/eccs2011/.

On 14-16 September 2011, in Zurich, the eighth conference on Applications of Social Network Analysis (ASNA 2011) took place at the University of Zurich and ETH Zurich (info@asna.ch). There were workshops on SIENA, Pnet, visone, Introduction to SNA, Applications of SNA and Historische Netzwerkforschung. The special thematic tracks organized at this year’s conference were Political Networks, Communication Networks, Peer Networks in Adolescence, and Historical Network Analysis.

On 14-16 September 2011, at Sheffield Hallam University, in Sheffield, England, the 12th ETHICOMP Conference, “The Social Impact of Social Computing”, took place. Visit http://www.ccsr.cse.dmu.ac.uk/conferences/ethicomp/ethicomp2011/.
On 19-23 September 2011, in Montpellier, France, the Seventh Conference of the European Social Simulation Association, “Social Network and Multi Agent Systems”, took place (snamas2011@res-ear.ch).
Le 23 septembre 2011, à Lille, la Journée d'études Observatoire des Réseaux Intra- et Inter-Organisationnels (ORIO) a eu lieu. Voir http://clerse.univ-lille1.fr/spip.php?article298.

Du 19 au 21 octobre 2011, au Laboratoire de Recherche en Informatique de Grenoble (LIG), à Grenoble, le seconde conférence sur les « Modèles et Analyse des Réseaux – Approches Mathématiques et Informatique » (MARAMI 2011) a eu lieu. Visiter http://marami-2011.imag.fr/.

On 27-28 October 2011, at the Castle Rauischholzhausen Conference Centre of the Justus-Liebig University of Giessen, in Giessen, Germany, the workshop, “Interviewers’ Deviant Behaviour – Reasons, Detection, Prevention”, took place. The workshop was organised as part of the project “Identification of Falsifications in Survey Data” within the DFG Priority Programme “Survey Methodology” (DFG SPP 1292). Visit http://www.uni-giessen.de/cms/ueber-uns/rhh/ or contact peter.winker@wirtschaft.uni-giessen.de.

On 17-18 November 2011, in Bremen, Germany, the Second International Conference “Advancing Survey Methods” was organized by the German coordination project of the Priority Programme on Survey Methodology (PPSM). See http://www.survey-methodology.de/en/termine_en.html.

On 29 November-1 December 2011, in Newcastle, Australia, The Australian Sociological Association (TASA) 2011 Conference, “Local Lives/Global Networks”, took place. See http://www.tasa.org.au/tasa-conference/2011-tasa-conference/.
